description: Install Prisma ORM with PostgreSQL adapter
steps: prisma and @prisma/client are listed in package.json
pnpm install completes without errors
npx prisma --version outputs a valid version
prisma/schema.prisma exists with PostgreSQL datasource configured

description: Install Clerk authentication SDK
steps: @clerk/nextjs is listed in package.json
pnpm install completes without errors
ClerkProvider can be imported from @clerk/nextjs without errors

description: Initialize shadcn/ui with required components
steps: shadcn init has been run (components.json exists at project root)
Tailwind CSS 4 integration is configured correctly
At least the following shadcn components are installed: accordion, button, card, toast/sonner, input, textarea
All installed components render without import errors

description: Install Embla Carousel via shadcn carousel component
steps: shadcn carousel component is installed
embla-carousel-react is listed in package.json
Carousel, CarouselContent, CarouselItem can be imported without errors

description: Install Vercel AI SDK
steps: ai package is listed in package.json
At least one AI provider package is listed (e.g. @ai-sdk/openai or @ai-sdk/anthropic)
pnpm install completes without errors
generateObject or generateText can be imported from ai without errors

description: Add environment variable validation for all required secrets
steps: src/env.js server schema validates DATABASE_URL as a string
src/env.js server schema validates CLERK_SECRET_KEY as a string
src/env.js client schema validates NEXT_PUBLIC_CLERK_PUBLISHABLE_KEY as a string
src/env.js validates the AI provider API key (e.g. OPENAI_API_KEY)
App fails to start if any required env var is missing

description: Define ScheduleEntry Prisma model
steps: ScheduleEntry model exists in prisma/schema.prisma
Fields: id (String, cuid, @id), userId (references User.id), weekday (Int), startTime (String), endTime (String), activity (String), createdAt (DateTime, @default(now()))
Model has an index on userId for efficient querying

description: Define FoodEntry Prisma model
steps: FoodEntry model exists in prisma/schema.prisma
Fields: id (String, cuid, @id), userId (references User.id), date (DateTime), mealType (String), description (String), feelings (String, optional/nullable), createdAt (DateTime, @default(now()))
Model has an index on userId for efficient querying

description: Define AiAnalysis Prisma model
steps: AiAnalysis model exists in prisma/schema.prisma

Fields: id (String, cuid, @id), userId (references User.id), recommended (Json), notRecommended (Json), avoidProducts (Json), lastEntryDate (DateTime), createdAt (DateTime, @default(now())), updatedAt (DateTime, @updatedAt)
Only one AiAnalysis record per user is enforced by @unique on userId

description: Add unique constraint on FoodEntry for userId + date + mealType
steps: prisma/schema.prisma has @@unique([userId, date, mealType]) on FoodEntry
Attempting to insert a duplicate userId + date + mealType combination throws a Prisma unique constraint error

description: Run Prisma migration and verify database tables
steps: npx prisma migrate dev runs successfully
prisma/migrations/ directory contains at least one migration
ScheduleEntry, FoodEntry, and AiAnalysis tables exist in the PostgreSQL database
npx prisma db push or prisma migrate deploy completes without errors

description: Configure Clerk with Google OAuth as the only sign-in method
steps: ClerkProvider wraps the app in the root layout
Clerk dashboard is configured with Google OAuth as the sole sign-in method
No email/password or other sign-in options are available to users
Google sign-in button appears on the Clerk sign-in page

description: Clerk middleware protects all application routes
steps: src/middleware.ts (or .js) exists and uses clerkMiddleware from @clerk/nextjs/server
Middleware matcher covers all app routes
Requesting any app route without a session returns a redirect response

description: Unauthenticated users are redirected to Clerk sign-in
steps: Visiting / without authentication redirects to the Clerk sign-in page
Visiting /food-diary without authentication redirects to the Clerk sign-in page
Visiting /ai-overview without authentication redirects to the Clerk sign-in page
After signing in, user is redirected back to the originally requested page

description: Clerk userId is accessible in server actions and API routes
steps: auth() from @clerk/nextjs/server returns a valid userId in server actions
auth() from @clerk/nextjs/server returns a valid userId in API route handlers
All database operations use the Clerk userId as the foreign key

description: Root layout with light theme, Geist font, and mobile-first design
steps: Page background is white/light (no dark theme)
Geist font is loaded via next/font/google and applied to the body
Viewport meta tag is set for mobile-first rendering
Text and elements are legible and well-sized on a 375px-wide viewport

description: Desktop max-width constraint with centered content
steps: On viewports wider than ~480px, the app content has a max-width constraint
Content is horizontally centered on desktop
Layout does not break or stretch awkwardly on a 1440px-wide viewport

description: Sticky bottom tab bar with 4 navigation items
steps: A bottom tab bar is fixed to the bottom of the viewport
Tab bar has exactly 4 items: Schedule, Food Diary, AI Overview, Settings
Each tab displays an icon and a label
Tab bar is visible on all pages (/, /food-diary, /ai-overview)
Tab bar does not scroll with page content

description: Active tab visual indicator matches current route
steps: On /, the Schedule tab is visually highlighted (e.g. different color/weight)
On /food-diary, the Food Diary tab is visually highlighted
On /ai-overview, the AI Overview tab is visually highlighted
Only one tab is highlighted at a time
Non-active tabs have a muted/default appearance

description: Schedule tab navigates to the home route
steps: Tapping Tab 1 (Calendar/Clock icon) navigates to /
The / route renders the Day Schedule page content
Navigation does not cause a full page reload (client-side navigation)

description: Food Diary tab navigates to /food-diary
steps: Tapping Tab 2 (Utensils/Book icon) navigates to /food-diary
The /food-diary route renders the Food Diary page content
Navigation does not cause a full page reload (client-side navigation)

description: AI Overview tab navigates to /ai-overview
steps: Tapping Tab 3 (Sparkles/Brain icon) navigates to /ai-overview
The /ai-overview route renders the AI Overview page content
Navigation does not cause a full page reload (client-side navigation)

description: Settings tab opens Clerk UserButton modal without route navigation
steps: Tapping Tab 4 (Gear icon) opens the Clerk UserButton or UserProfile modal
The browser URL does not change when the modal opens
No new page route is rendered; the modal overlays the current page

description: Clerk modal supports profile management and sign out
steps: User can view their profile information in the modal
User can manage their Google account connection
User can sign out from the modal
After sign out, user is redirected to the Clerk sign-in page

description: 7-slide horizontal carousel for the weekly schedule
steps: The / page renders a horizontal carousel with exactly 7 slides
Slides represent Monday through Sunday in order
Week starts on Monday (first slide) and ends on Sunday (last slide)
User can swipe left/right to navigate between days

description: Carousel wraps around infinitely
steps: Swiping right from Sunday transitions to Monday
Swiping left from Monday transitions to Sunday
Wrap-around transitions are smooth, not jarring

description: Carousel auto-scrolls to the current weekday on load
steps: On initial page load, the carousel displays the slide for today's weekday
If today is Wednesday, the Wednesday slide is visible without user interaction
Auto-scroll happens without a noticeable visual jump or flicker

description: Day name header displayed on each carousel slide
steps: Each slide has a visible header showing the full day name (e.g. Monday, Tuesday)
The header is positioned at the top of the slide
All 7 slides have their correct corresponding day name

description: Activities listed and sorted ascending by start time
steps: Activities for a given day are displayed as a vertical list
Activities are sorted by start time in ascending order (earliest first)
Adding an activity with an earlier start time places it above later activities

description: Activity row displays time range in 24h format and activity name
steps: Each activity row shows the time range in 24h format (e.g. '09:00 - 10:30')
The activity name is displayed next to or below the time range
Both time range and activity name are legible and properly formatted

description: Empty day shows placeholder text
steps: A day with no activities shows the text 'No activities yet' or equivalent
The placeholder is visually distinct from activity rows (e.g. muted text)
The add form is still visible below the placeholder

description: Inline activity form is sticky at the bottom of each day slide
steps: Each day slide has an activity creation form at the bottom
The form remains visible (sticky/fixed) when scrolling through a long activity list
The form is inside or visually associated with the current slide

description: Start time picker input in 24h format
steps: The form includes a time input for start time
The input uses 24h format (e.g. 14:30, not 2:30 PM)
User can select or type a valid time value

description: End time picker input in 24h format
steps: The form includes a time input for end time
The input uses 24h format (e.g. 14:30, not 2:30 PM)
User can select or type a valid time value

description: Activity text input with submit button
steps: The form includes a text input for the activity name
A submit button is present and clearly labeled
The button is disabled or shows validation when required fields are empty
Pressing submit with valid data creates the activity

description: Form clears after successful submission
steps: After successfully creating an activity, the start time input is cleared
The end time input is cleared
The activity name input is cleared
The form is ready for the next entry without manual clearing

description: Long-press on activity row reveals delete option
steps: Long-pressing (touch-and-hold) on an activity row reveals a delete action
The delete option is clearly visible (e.g. button, icon, or context menu)
A normal tap does not trigger the delete option
The delete option disappears if the user cancels (taps elsewhere)

description: Delete removes an individual activity
steps: Tapping the delete option removes the activity from the list
The activity is deleted from the database
Other activities on the same day remain unaffected
The UI updates to reflect the deletion

description: Optimistic UI update on activity creation
steps: After submitting a new activity, it appears in the list immediately (before server response)
If the server action fails, the optimistically added activity is removed
An error message is shown if the server action fails
On success, the optimistic entry is confirmed (no flicker or duplication)

description: Overlap validation with visual warning that allows save
steps: If a new activity's time range overlaps with an existing activity, a warning is displayed
The warning is shown inline near the form (not a blocking modal)
The user can still submit the form despite the overlap warning
The activity is saved successfully even with an overlap

description: Server action to create a schedule entry for a weekday
steps: A server action exists that accepts weekday, startTime, endTime, and activity
The action uses the authenticated Clerk userId
A new ScheduleEntry row is inserted into the database
The action revalidates the schedule data after creation

description: Server action to read all schedule entries grouped by weekday
steps: A server action or server component query fetches all ScheduleEntries for the authenticated user
Results are grouped or queryable by weekday (0-6)
Only entries belonging to the current user are returned
Entries are ordered by startTime ascending within each weekday

description: Server action to delete a schedule entry by ID
steps: A server action exists that accepts a schedule entry ID
The action verifies the entry belongs to the authenticated user before deleting
The entry is removed from the database
The action revalidates the schedule data after deletion

description: Current date displayed at top of Food Diary page
steps: The /food-diary page shows the current date at the top
The date is read-only (not editable or selectable)
The date always reflects today's date
The date format is clear and human-readable (e.g. 'Thursday, February 19, 2026')

description: Five accordion sections for meal types
steps: The page displays 5 accordion sections in vertical scroll
Sections are labeled: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner, Supper, Party
Sections appear in the order listed above
Each accordion can be expanded and collapsed independently

description: Maximum one entry per meal type per day enforced in UI
steps: Once a food description is saved for a meal type, the save form for that description is no longer shown
There is no way to create a second entry for the same meal type on the same day
The UI reflects whether an entry already exists for each meal type

description: Accordion empty state shows food description form with feelings disabled
steps: When no record exists for a meal type, expanding the accordion shows a food description textarea
A Save button is present next to or below the textarea
The feelings textarea is either hidden or visually disabled
User cannot input or save feelings before saving the food description

description: Accordion description-saved state enables feelings input
steps: After saving a food description, the description is displayed in read-only mode
The feelings textarea is now visible and enabled
A Save button is present for the feelings field
User can type in the feelings textarea and submit

description: Both-saved state renders description and feelings as read-only
steps: After both food description and feelings are saved, both are displayed as read-only text
No edit or delete buttons are shown
The accordion can still be expanded/collapsed to view the content

description: Food diary entries are locked once submitted
steps: After a food description is saved, there is no way to edit or delete it from the UI
After feelings are saved, there is no way to edit or delete them from the UI
No delete button or edit action is available for any submitted entry

description: Meals not eaten have no record and no skip button
steps: If a user did not eat a meal, the accordion for that meal type shows the empty state
There is no 'skip' or 'didn't eat' button
Unlogged meals do not create any database record

description: Server action to create a food entry with description only
steps: A server action exists that accepts date, mealType, and description
The action uses the authenticated Clerk userId
A new FoodEntry row is inserted with feelings set to null
The action revalidates the food diary data after creation

description: Server action to read all food entries for today
steps: A server action or server component query fetches all FoodEntries for the authenticated user for today's date
Only entries matching today's date are returned
Only entries belonging to the current user are returned
All 5 meal types are queryable (breakfast, lunch, dinner, supper, party)

description: Server action to update a food entry with feelings
steps: A server action exists that accepts a food entry ID and feelings text
The action verifies the entry belongs to the authenticated user
The feelings field is updated on the existing FoodEntry record
The action revalidates the food diary data after update

description: Three analysis cards for AI results
steps: The /ai-overview page displays 3 distinct card sections
Card 1 is titled 'Recommended Dishes'
Card 2 is titled 'Strictly Not Recommended'
Card 3 is titled 'Products/Ingredients to Avoid'
Each card renders its content as a formatted list of items with reasons

description: Each analysis card shows AI-generated content as a formatted list
steps: Recommended card shows items as { dish, reason } entries
Not Recommended card shows items as { dish, reason } entries
Avoid Products card shows items as { product, reason } entries
Each list item displays both the name and the reasoning

description: Last updated timestamp indicator
steps: A 'Last updated' label is displayed at the top of the AI Overview page
The timestamp shows the relative or absolute time of the most recent analysis
The timestamp updates after a new analysis is generated

description: Empty state with explanation and generate button
steps: When no AI analysis exists, explanation text describes what the feature does
A 'Generate your first analysis' button is displayed
The analysis cards are not shown in the empty state

description: Generate button disabled until 14+ food entries with progress message
steps: The 'Generate your first analysis' button is disabled when the user has fewer than 14 food entries
A message like 'Log at least 14 meals to unlock AI analysis (X/14 so far)' is shown
X reflects the actual count of the user's food entries
The button becomes enabled once the user reaches 14 or more entries

description: Update analysis button sends incremental data
steps: An 'Update based on latest data' button is visible after the first analysis exists
Pressing the button triggers a request with mode 'incremental'
The request sends the previous analysis results plus only food entries since lastEntryDate
The result replaces the stored analysis in the database

description: Regenerate analysis button sends full data
steps: A 'Regenerate from full data' button is visible after the first analysis exists
Pressing the button triggers a request with mode 'full'
The request sends the complete food diary history for the user
The result replaces the stored analysis in the database

description: Analysis action buttons disabled while processing
steps: After pressing either analysis button, both buttons become disabled
Buttons remain disabled until the processing completes or the page is refreshed
A user cannot trigger multiple simultaneous analysis requests

description: Processing toast notification on analysis trigger
steps: After pressing an analysis button, a toast notification appears at the bottom of the screen
The toast message is 'Analysis in progress. Results will appear shortly -- please refresh.' or equivalent
The toast does not block user interaction with the rest of the page

description: POST /api/ai/analyze route handler accepts mode parameter
steps: A route handler exists at src/app/api/ai/analyze/route.ts
The handler accepts POST requests with a JSON body containing { mode: 'incremental' | 'full' }
The handler validates the mode parameter
The handler verifies the user is authenticated via Clerk

description: AI system prompt configured as nutrition/wellness analyst
steps: The AI call includes a system prompt defining the role as a nutrition/wellness analyst
The prompt instructs the AI to correlate food descriptions with reported feelings
The prompt instructs the AI to identify patterns between diet and emotional/physical states

description: Incremental mode sends previous analysis plus new entries
steps: When mode is 'incremental', the existing AiAnalysis record is fetched from the database
Only food entries with dates after lastEntryDate are queried
Both the previous analysis JSON and the new food entries are included in the AI prompt
The AI is instructed to revise/extend its existing analysis with the new data

description: Full mode sends all food entries for the user
steps: When mode is 'full', all FoodEntry records for the user are queried
All entries (date, mealType, description, feelings) are included in the AI prompt
No previous analysis is sent; the AI produces a fresh analysis from scratch

description: AI output parsed and stored as structured JSON in AiAnalysis
steps: The AI response is parsed as JSON with three arrays: recommended, notRecommended, avoidProducts
recommended items have { dish: string, reason: string } shape
notRecommended items have { dish: string, reason: string } shape
avoidProducts items have { product: string, reason: string } shape
The parsed result is upserted into the AiAnalysis table with the userId
lastEntryDate is updated to the date of the newest food entry included

description: Web app manifest with app name, icons, and theme color
steps: A manifest.json or manifest.webmanifest file exists in the public directory
The manifest includes a name and short_name for the app
The manifest includes at least one icon (192x192 and 512x512 recommended)
The manifest includes a theme_color value
The manifest is linked in the root layout via <link rel='manifest'> or metadata

description: PWA display mode set to standalone
steps: The manifest.json display property is set to 'standalone'
When installed on a mobile device, the app opens without browser chrome

description: PWA orientation set to portrait
steps: The manifest.json orientation property is set to 'portrait'
The installed app defaults to portrait orientation on mobile

description: App shell cached for instant load via service worker
steps: A service worker is registered that caches the app shell (HTML, CSS, JS bundles)
On subsequent visits, the app shell loads instantly from cache
Data requests still require a network connection (no offline data sync)

description: App is installable on mobile devices
steps: The PWA meets Chrome/Safari installability requirements (manifest + service worker + HTTPS)
The browser shows an 'Add to Home Screen' prompt or the option is available in the browser menu
After installation, the app appears on the device home screen with the configured icon

description: Success feedback via toast notifications at the bottom of the screen
steps: Successful mutations (create activity, save food entry, save feelings) trigger a toast notification
The toast appears at the bottom of the screen
The toast auto-dismisses after a few seconds
The toast message describes the successful action

description: Error feedback via inline messages next to the relevant form field
steps: Validation errors are displayed inline near the offending input field
Server errors show an inline message near the form that triggered the action
Error messages are descriptive and help the user fix the issue
Errors do not use toast notifications (those are reserved for success)
